Description:
Presto-PS Rain Sensor for Controllers and Timers irrigation

Rain sensor Presto-PS (7806) is used in combination with electronic timers and controllers and allows you to automatically turn off the water supply in case of precipitation. The sensor reacts to precipitation and turns off the water supply for irrigation.

In the upper part of the case there are holes for catching raindrops, which wet special discs that swell from moisture and press the button with a rod. The button opens the circuit and the timer does not include the watering program.

When the discs are dry, they are compressed, the button is released and the watering timer continues to perform its functions.

The sensor is connected to the watering timer with a 7-meter cable. There is a jack plug at the end of the cable. The sensor is suitable for watering timers that have a suitable socket. Timers and controllers without such a socket can be connected by removing the plug and connecting the wires directly to the contacts for connecting the sensor.

Advantages

  • The sensor can be programmed to trigger with an average amount of precipitation of 3 mm., 6 mm., 12 mm., 19 mm. and 25 mm.
  • Universal mounting bracket with quick clamp
  • No additional maintenance required
  • Cable length 7m.
  • Return time on weekend state: about 4 hours in dry sunny weather
  • Time to return to original state from high humidity state: about 3 days in dry sunny weather
  • The frost sensor stops the system when the temperature drops to +3ºС

Description:
Hunter WR-Click Wireless Rain Sensor

Hunter WR-Click wireless rain sensor model is completely autonomous thanks to the use of a battery of increased capacity (working life is 10 years). This device is fully compatible with most existing electronic control units. The undoubted advantage of the kit is the complete absence of wires for connecting the sensors, that is, there is no need to lay them or dig trenches for their installation.

To prevent unwanted water losses, the built-in Quick Response™ technology instantly turns off watering immediately after the start of rain.

Most devices designed to detect rain first accumulate a set amount of precipitation, and only after that a switch is triggered that disconnects the circuit from the controller and disables the system. During this "accumulation period", the system continues to waste water. This can be particularly disadvantageous for municipalities, businesses and residential property owners for whom cost savings is key.

Using built-in Quick Response technology, Hunter's wired and wireless Rain-Clik sensors can provide to the controller, the shutdown command immediately after the start of rain.

Principle of operation

When water hits the sensor, the cork tree placed inside swells, which causes the contact to open, i.e. the signal is sent to the controller. Further, the control unit, having processed the information, shuts off the water or prevents its further supply during rain.

The contact is closed when the plug dries - approximately 4 hours in sunny and warm weather. It takes up to 3 days for complete soaking (heavy and constant rainfall).

Important! In the event of frost, the Hunter WR-Click Wireless Rain Sensor (Frost Sensor) automatically turns off the automatic irrigation system.

Using built-in Quick Response technology, Hunter's wired and wireless Rain-Clik sensors can provide the controller will send the shutdown command immediately after the start of rain.

Rain-Clik can be installed on an eaves or any flat vertical surface (for example, on a wall or fences). A special mount is also offered, which allows you to easily mount the sensor on the edge of the gutter.

Description:
Hunter Solar Sync-Sen high-tech weather sensor calculates evapotranspiration (ET) indicator

Solar Sync is a sensor system that involves connecting to the compatibility of the Hunter controller automatically adjusts the occurrence of the irrigation controller taking into account changes in the climate of climatic conditions. In the Solar Sync system, sensors of increased density and temperature are used to determine evapotranspiration (ET) indicators on the territory of the site, as well as the speed at which plants and turf use the applied load. In addition, Solar Sync includes Hunter's Rain-Clik® Rain and Freeze-Clik® Freeze Sensors, which shut off your irrigation system during rain and/or freezing weather.

Ultimately, a new efficient irrigation system is produced that will save water and improve the condition of the plants on the site. Program the controller as usual and Solar Sync goes all out, with manual watering schedule adjustments possible.

The Solar Sync system can be easily installed on any supported Hunter device controller (see owner's manual or owner's manual controller to see if it is compatible with Solar Sync). The system consists of a sensor and a receiver. The receiver is required only in the assembly with the wireless sensor. The sensor should be triggered when atmospheric emissions are triggered, in which the maximum amount of increased radiation is set. The receiver is installed next to or on top of the Hunter controller. The Solar Sync sensor measures the amount of light and temperature, and also calculates the daily evapotranspiration (ET) in order to provide the best quality irrigation.

This option is the amount of water that plants lose under the influence of local climatic factors, and which must be replenished with irrigation. The Solar Sync sensor also comes with a Hunter Rain-Clik sensor that automatically shuts off the irrigation system when it rains, preventing excessive water use. Enter the midsummer watering schedule on the controller according to the instructions in the Owner's Manual. Solar Sync receives data from the sensor and applies it to the controller's watering schedule, changing the programmed watering duration through the controller's seasonal adjustment feature.

Solar Sync System Components

Rain-Clik sensor prevents watering from starting or continuing during rain. It requires no setup or calibration. Rain-Clik uses patented Quick Response® technology that shuts off the irrigation system within the first few minutes after it starts raining. The only element that needs to be adjusted is the ventilation ring, which allows you to slow down or speed up the drying process of the sensor and the time of reactivation of the irrigation system. Opening
vents accelerates drying of the sensor, closing them slows it down.

In addition, the built-in Solar Sync temperature sensor shuts down the system when frost is detected. At temperatures around 37°F (3°C) and below, Solar Sync signals the controller to stop watering. After the sensor is activated, the message "Sensor off" is displayed on the controller display. When the temperature rises above 37°F (3°C), automatic watering is turned back on.

Solar Sync Wireless System Components

Into Solar Wireless System Design Sync includes a downward pointing antenna, which ensures communication with the receiver.

Section: Automatic Watering Equipment / Weather Sensors / Hunter Weather Sensors
Description:
Hunter Soil-Clik soil moisture sensor< /h3>

This sensor allows you to avoid water loss by measuring soil moisture and turning off watering when a preset level is reached.

Soil-Clik simplifies the procedure for determining soil moisture. The Soil-Clik sensitive element uses time-tested technology to measure moisture levels in the root zone of plants. When the sensitive element detects that the required level of soil moisture has been reached, the sensor turns off irrigation, preventing excessive water consumption.

Soil-Clik consists of two components - a sensitive element for determining the level of moisture placed in the soil and an electronic module , which exchanges data with the sensitive element and the controller. The sensitive element is installed very easily: it is enough to bury it in the soil at the depth of the root zone of the plant material. The sensor can be placed at a distance of 300 meters from the controller. Each press of the button allows you to adjust the required level of humidity and leads to an immediate update of the measured value.

The module can be connected to any AC powered Hunter controllers. In addition, it is compatible with most third-party AC-powered controllers. The Soil-Clik sensor can be programmed to shut off the irrigation system when sufficient moisture is reached.

Backed by Hunter's 5-year warranty, the Soil-Clik sensor is an effective water-saving solution when used alone or in combination with the Solar Sync® sensor, while allowing to implement the most ecological solution.

Dimensions

  • < strong>Soil-Clik module: Height: 11 cm./ Width: 3.2 cm./ Length: 8.9 cm.
  • Soil-Clik sensor: Height: 8.3 cm./ Diameter: 2 cm.

Advantages

  • Instant view of soil moisture level and system status
  • The one-click shutdown function allows you to ignore the soil moisture indicator in special operating conditions
  • Low voltage model in an outdoor mounting case with power from the main controller
  • Possibility to connect to inputs for Hunter sensors or use to open conventional wiring virtually in any irrigation system with a supply voltage of ~24 V
  • Used in conjunction with the Solar Sync™ sensor to ensure maximum water savings

Operational characteristics

  • Switching current (~24 V): 5 A

  • Certificates: UL, CUL, FCC, CE, RCM

Selecting a location for the contact sensor

The sensitive element is installed in the root zone to ensure proper control of soil moisture.

When used in turf, the sensor should be placed in the root zone at a depth of approximately 15 cm (depending on the condition turf).

When using in an area with trees and shrubs, choose a deeper location according to the root zone. In the area with newly planted seedlings, place the sensor in the native soil at a depth of about half of the root ball.

Description:
Hunter SOLAR SYNC KIT

Solar Sync is a sensor system designed for use with compatible Hunter controllers to automatically adjust watering parameters based on changes in local weather conditions.

Complete

The Solar Sync system uses solar radiation and temperature sensors to determine total evapotranspiration (ET) on the site and the rate at which plants and turf absorb moisture.

It also includes Rain-Clik™ and Freeze-Clik™ sensors that allow you to automatically turn off the irrigation system during rain and frost.

The sensor communicates with the controller with the help of a compact control module, which allows you to automatically increase or decrease the operation time of the irrigation system depending on changes in weather conditions.

As a result, you get a new efficient irrigation system that saves water and will improve the condition of the plants on the site. Program the controller as usual and Solar Sync will do the rest
, eliminating the need to manually adjust the watering schedule.

Principle of work

Solar Sync wireless system is easy and simple install on any compatible Hunter Irrigation Controller (see Owner's Manual for compatibility).

Solar Sync wireless sensor measures solar radiation and temperature and calculates daily total evapotranspiration (ET) to adjust irrigation. The latter reflects the amount of moisture lost by plants under the influence of local climatic factors, which must be replenished with irrigation. The Solar Sync Wireless System also includes Rain-Clik™ and Freeze-Clik® sensors that allow you to automatically turn off the irrigation system in the event of rain or frost.

Set a midsummer watering schedule in the controller by following the programming instructions in your controller's manual. The Solar Sync sensor sends weather data to the control module, which adjusts the controller's watering schedule using the seasonal adjustment function.

This user guide applies to the following kits:

  • WSS: Solar Sync Wireless Sensor Set for Hunter Pro-C, PCC, ICC and I-Core Controllers
  • WSSSEN*: Solar Sync Wireless Sensor Set for Hunter ACC and X Controllers -Core

* - Please note that the Solar Sync control module is not included in the WSSSEN kit. ACC and X-Core controllers have built-in Solar Sync software, eliminating the need for a separate control module. Therefore, the WSSSEN kit is intended for use with ACC and X-Core controllers only.

Hunter Freeze-Clik to disable sprinklers for a period frost

Use this sensor to turn off sprinklers during frost and ensure reliable protection of landscaping areas, walkways and driveways from icicles.

Unintentionally turning on the irrigation system during a significant freeze is one of the worst things that can happen to a landscape design area. In some regions with unpredictable temperature fluctuations, watering during frost is a danger not only to the specific object, but also to those who may pass or drive by it.

By connecting the Freeze-Clik sensor to the system from company Hunter, these experiences can be forgotten. When frost is detected, the Freeze-Clik sensor automatically turns off the irrigation system. When the temperature rises to an acceptable level for watering, the Freeze-Clik sensor activates the irrigation system according to the program.

The Freeze-Clik sensor is easy to install and easy to use. In addition, it can be used in conjunction with other weather-sensing devices to ensure efficient watering regardless of the vagaries of the weather.

Description:
Hunter SC-Probe Soil Moisture Sensor for Node -BT

The new technology simplifies the measurement of soil moisture. Irrigation turns off when the desired moisture level is reached. The sensor uses a proven technology to measure moisture right in the root zone.

As soon as the sensor understands that the soil has the required moisture level, it will turn off irrigation, preventing water loss. The device consists of two components: a moisture sensor probe, it is placed in the soil, and an electronic module, it communicates with the probe and the controller.

Advantages

  • Instant view of soil moisture level and system status
  • One-touch shutdown function allows you to ignore indicator of soil moisture in special operating conditions
  • Low-voltage model in a housing for outdoor installation with power from the main controller
  • Possibility of connecting to the inputs for Hunter sensors or used to open conventional conductive lines in almost any which irrigation system with a supply voltage of ~24 V
  • Used in conjunction with a Solar Sync™ sensor to ensure maximum water savings

Operational characteristics

  • Switching current (~24 V): 5 A
  • Current consumption (~24 V): 100 mA
  • Shutdown by means of a normally closed dry contact
  • Maximum distance from the Soil-Clik module to the controller: 2m.
  • Maximum distance from the Soil-Clik module to the sensor element in AC power systems: 300 m.
  • Maximum distance in NODE-BT based systems: 30 m
  • The sensitive element of the sensor is equipped with a wire 80 cm long, which is designed to be laid directly in the soil
  • Certificates: UL, CUL, FCC, CE, RCM

Installation

The probe does not require special installation skills - you just need to bury it to the required root depth. It can be placed at a distance of 300 meters from the controller. Simple button operation allows you to adjust the desired humidity level with an immediate update of the actual measurements.

The module connects to all Hunter AC powered controllers and will work with AC powered controllers from many other manufacturers. The device can be programmed to turn off watering when it senses sufficient moisture.

Backed by Hunter's 5-year warranty, the sensor is an effective water-saving device either by itself or as an addition to an irrigation system for an environmentally friendly solution.< /p>

When using in turf, the sensor should be placed in the root zone at a depth of approximately 15 cm (depending on the condition turf).

When using in an area with trees and shrubs, choose a deeper location according to the root zone. In the area with newly planted seedlings, place the sensor in the native soil at a depth of about half of the root ball.

Hunter SPNODE solar panel
The need to fully provide automated irrigation systems with electricity could not be closed . The proposed model of the Hunter SPNODE solar panel provides continuous recovery of the entire system in use by converting solar energy into electricity.

Attention! Fasteners for the panel are included in its initial set, which makes it possible to immediately install the solar battery. It is recommended to perform the installation in an open area, where there are no obstacles to the sun's rays.

Hunter Solar Panel Kit (SPNODE)

Hunter Solar Panel Kit (SPNODE) - new accessory for battery-powered Node and XC Hybrid controllers.

Once connected, the SPNODE panel will supply the control panel with 100% of the energy it needs by accumulating solar energy. There will be no need to use batteries.

Principle of operation

The sun's rays, falling on the surface of the panel, more precisely between the layers of the semiconductor used, contribute to the emergence of valve photo-EMF. As a result, a potential difference is formed, that is, an electric current is formed, which flows to the consumer.

Important! If the photocell (plate) is damaged, it is not recommended to repair it yourself - you need to contact a specialist, which will eliminate the problem.

The panel is an eco-innovative alternative to conventional power sources, is more ecological and guarantees trouble-free operation, while requiring no maintenance, using solar energy to power the controller 24/7 for years, even in overcast weather. .

In the kit, the Hunter SPNODE solar panel includes all the necessary components for its fastening and connection.

After connecting the panel to the network, it may take some time to recharge the controller. It shouldn't take long at all. The advantage of using this device is that you will not need to buy batteries for the remote control, the charge of which tends to run out.

Operational characteristics

  • Eliminates the need for batteries and provides maintenance-free operation
  • Maximum wire distance from the remote control to the solar panel is 61 m.
  • Easy connection: the battery needs to be removed, which comes with the standard controller, and replace it with a charging module connected to the solar panel.
  • Easy installation: you need to place the solar panel in an area with a lot of sun (on the eaves, high fence or reinforced gutter)

Description:
Sime Synkro sectoral and circular irrigation water cannon 25°. sprinkler machines - drum and circular. And it can also be used for mobile and stationary installations.

The adjustable jet interrupter, which works only on the return, allows you to achieve a uniform distribution of precipitation over the entire irrigated area.

Its work, based on based on a completely new concept, prevents any vibrations and counter-shocks, ensuring absolute safety for the user, and also allows it to be used on very steep slopes.

  • Productivity up to 52.9 m3/h.

  • adjustable stops for full or partial coverage
  • adjustable jet interrupter to change the shape of the jet and quick-change nozzle adjustment
  • standard tubular 2 1/2" thread

Applications

The SYNKRO sprinkler is an impact sprinkler. The energy of the flowing water pushes the pendulum (oscillator), which, under the action of the spring, returns to its original position and hits the rear part of the plastic switch on the jet pipe. This is how the sprinkler rotates. The sprinkler rotates when it reaches the right pivot point, which is determined by the rings on the sprinkler base. The switch clicks automatically and the pendulum swings the other way, which now hits the plastic switch blocking it on the opposite side. The sprinkler moves at the same speed in both directions. Setting the spray angle with the help of movable rings on the base. Together with the movement of the pendulum, the diffuser interacts, which, when the sprinkler turns, sinks into the stream of water, shortening the radius and dispersing.

The lower base is made of brass, the inner rotating sleeve is made of stainless steel. The body of the sprinkler, the jet tube and the pendulum are made of light aluminum alloys. Nozzles made of wear-resistant plastic. Stainless steel springs. Bearing of rotary joint and pendulum. U-type rubber seal. Comes with a set of 3 replacement nozzles. You can use nozzles from 10 to 24 mm. In addition, it has adjustment: dispersion and rotation speed.

The biggest advantage of a pulse sprinkler is that only one sprinkler can effectively water the entire area within its radius of action (at unlike spray and rotary sprinklers, which do not water under themselves). Application

The RANGER sprayer is an impact sprayer. The energy of the flowing water pushes the pendulum (oscillator), which under the action of the spring returns to its original position and hits the back of the plastic switch on the jet pipe. This is how the sprinkler rotates. The sprinkler rotates when it reaches the right pivot point, which is determined by the rings on the sprinkler base. The switch clicks automatically and the pendulum swings the other way, which now hits the plastic switch blocking it on the opposite side. The sprinkler moves at the same speed in both directions. Setting the spray angle using movable rings on the base. Together with the movement of the pendulum, the diffuser interacts, which, when the sprinkler turns, sinks into the stream of water, shortening the radius and dispersing.

The lower base is made of brass, the inner rotating sleeve is made of stainless steel. The body of the sprinkler, the jet tube and the pendulum are made of light aluminum alloys. Nozzles made of wear-resistant plastic. Stainless steel springs. Bearing of rotary joint and pendulum. U-type rubber seal. Comes with a set of 3 replacement nozzles. The possibility of using nozzles from 18 to 36 mm. In addition, it has adjustment: dispersion and rotation speed.

The biggest advantage of a pulse sprinkler is that only one sprinkler can effectively water the entire area within its radius of action (at unlike spray and rotary sprinklers, which do not water under themselves). Description:
Eve Aqua Smart Water Controller Apple Homekit

Eve Aqua is great hardware with software that takes ease of use to the next level. This multi-functional solution is easy to install and makes it easy to connect your home irrigation system with HomeKit.

The smart water controller securely attaches to an outdoor faucet, and thanks to the accessory's standard 26.5mm/G ¾" thread, you can easily connect conventional hoses and other popular hose systems (such as Gardena or K&rcher) with the included hose.

  • Autonomous schedules
  • 7 watering periods/day
  • No bridge and sluice
  • Compatible with all popular hose systems
  • Bluetooth and flow
  • High data privacy

Eve Aqua has a single built-in button that starts or stops the water flow with a single touch Tap once and the valve will open. Eve Aqua will automatically turn off the water supply after a set time that you can set in the Eve app - a really easy way to water your lawn without wasting precious water. Eve Aqua is also equipped with HomeKit technology and enough memory to store complex schedules. This means you can start watering from your iPhone or Siri, and if you have a home hub, you can even do it while on vacation. You can also take it a step further and use Eve to add schedules that are then stored in Eve Aqua for a fully automated irrigation system.

The latest generation Eve Aqua supports Bluetooth and Thread and automatically connects to your Thread networks. Thread makes your smart home network more responsive, reliable, and extends its reach—all you need is the HomePod mini. You can even add Thread support to the latest generation Eve Aqua by simply updating the accessory's firmware.

Flow control

Using a schedule

A schedule starts regular watering of the garden in at the time and for the period you specify. Because schedules are stored directly in Eve Aqua, they can be run at any time—whether Eve Aqua is connected to your iPhone or the Internet, all without a bridge or gateway.

Via iPhone, Siri or directly on the device

You can water at any time with one push of a button on board. But it is even more convenient to control Eve Aqua from iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch and with the help of Siri.

Stopping schedule

On vacation you saw in the summary weather that the heat is about to set in at home. Not a problem. With your home hub — HomePod, HomePod mini, or Apple TV — you can stay connected and easily water your garden on the go. If the weather turns out to be better than forecast, you can stop the schedule whenever you want, wherever you are.

Auto shut off< /p>

Water losses and floods due to forgetfulness are a thing of the past. After you've manually started watering, Eve Aqua automatically shuts off the water again after a time you specify once - reliably, quickly and silently thanks to the magnetic valve.

How much water is your garden using? The Eve program constantly calculates the amount of watering.;

Eve Aqua can be controlled via the Eve app, Home and Siri

Installation

You can install Eve Aqua on almost any outdoor faucet. Just make sure you screw the accessory all the way onto the faucet with your fingers and that it's securely attached to prevent leaks.

To insert or replace the batteries, press gently with your thumbs on the ridged surface at the bottom of the Eve Aqua and then slide the lid forward. The tape makes it easy to remove the batteries - just wrap it around them and fully insert them into the compartment before closing the cover. Leaving it hanging outside can cause moisture to enter the case and battery compartment.

At the end of the gardening season, protect Eve Aqua from frost, like most loose irrigation devices, to avoid damage to moving parts, seals, and fasteners. It is best to unscrew the Eve Aqua from the tap, clean the accessory, open the valve, remove the batteries and allow everything to dry thoroughly before putting it away for the winter.

Thanks to the standard thread, hose connection and the ability to withstand a wide range of pressures of water (1 bar/14.5 psi to 5 bar/72.5 psi) Eve Aqua is ideal for use with all conventional irrigation systems. You can also connect it to a 2-prong jack, among other types of multi-channel splitters. With this setup, Eve Aqua is always supplied with water, leaving you with one outlet to connect a conventional hose. The possibilities are truly endless.

Eve Aqua is compatible with all popular hose systems and multi-channel water dispensers such as Gardena or K&aucher and can be installed in minutes. It's also ideal for more complex watering tasks, as Eve allows you to set up to seven individual daily watering periods for each day.

Even if you only go on weekends , flowers in pots or vegetables in raised beds still require regular watering. Prevent them from wilting by solving this problem quickly and economically with Eve Aqua and the Gardena micro-drip irrigation system.

Thanks to the two-channel water distributor you can use Eve Aqua for watering without turning off the faucet. and you won't need to take Eve Aqua off when you just need to fill the kiddie pool or wash your hands.

Technical requirements
  • iPhone or iPad with the latest version of iOS/iPadOS
  • HomePod or Apple TV (4th generation or later) is required as a home hub to automatically control this HomeKit-enabled accessory away from home

  • IPX4 waterproof
  • UV protection
  • Charging: 2 replaceable AA batteries
  • Wireless connection
  • Dimensions: 77x95x128 mm

Complete set

  • Instructions

You can press the button and hold it for more than 2 seconds until the light turns on, then press the time delay button once, the start of watering will be postponed only one hour later, so in this case you press the delay button twice - watering will take place after two hours , so the first watering will start at 12:00.

Section: Self-Watering Equipment / Underground Root Irrigation System / Hunter Underground Root Irrigation System
Description:
Hunter RZWS-18 Root Watering System

For the successful growth of young plants and trees, it is necessary to ensure adequate irrigation and a constant supply of oxygen at all levels of the root zone. This stimulates the roots to grow deep and prevents them from "creeping" to the surface, allowing the plants to be strong and well established in the ground.

The root irrigation system, equipped with Hunter's patented design solution - StrataRoot™, which is a series of in-soil diffusers that direct water, oxygen and nutrients to the root zone and ensure the strength of the irrigation cylinder design.

< img alt="" height="646" loading="lazy" src="/content/uploads/images/hunter/rzws_13.jpg" width="510"/>

RZWS comes in pre-assembled for easy installation, and the closed design and protective grills prevent intentional damage to the irrigation equipment.

Hunter RZWS is the optimal solution for efficient irrigation of the entire root zone of trees and shrubs.

< iframe allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="400" loading="lazy" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/luy4Xd_cpRA" title="YouTube video player" width ="100%">

Benefits

  • Built-in flexible Hunter elbow for direct connection with 1/2" PVC fittings< /li>
  • Hunter pressure-compensated bubbler for precise water delivery
  • Watering system delivered ready-made
  • Patented StrataRoot™ diffusers to deliver water to the roots and increase irrigation efficiency
  • Anti-vandal cover

Technical characteristics

  • Bubbler consumption: 0.9 or 1.9 l/min
  • Recommended working pressure: 1.0-4.8 bar; 100-480 kPa
  • Size: 25, 45, 90 cm.

Installation

Dig holes of the required diameter and depth, each hole should be at least 5 inches in diameter and 5 inches deep must ensure the possibility of installing the RZWS module flush with the ground surface. To set the RZWS module to a depth it was not designed for, it can be trimmed.

Place the modules around the tree at equal intervals at a distance equal to half the width of the tree crown. The choice of RZWS module type depends on the tree's watering requirements. A minimum of two RZWS modules must be used per tree.

If RZWS models supplied without internal equipment are used, add the appropriate watering devices. Connect each module to the lateral line system.

Backfill the recesses around the RZWS modules. On sandy soils, use a filter material sleeve to prevent soil from entering the device. Hunter product number: RZWS SLEEVE.

Strictly follow recommendations for planting specific tree species based on local conditions.

Note. Under the maintenance time of the RZWS module must use a special a tool that allows you to access the necessary components and unlock the two clips on the cover.

Section: Drip Irrigation / Drip Tube / No Drippers / No Drippers Presto-PS
Description:
Drip tube blind Presto-PS for organizing systems drip irrigation

A blind drip tube is the most versatile and inexpensive choice for creating a drip irrigation system. The main advantage of a blind drip tube, in comparison with a drip tape and a perennial tube with drippers, is the ability to organize irrigation in areas with unevenly planted plants.

To build a system based on a blind tube, it is necessary to additionally purchase garden drippers. The distance between the droppers is set arbitrarily, depending on the location of a particular plant. Droppers are installed under the root in holes prepared in advance with a hole punch.

Presto-PS blind drip tube is a PVC tube with a diameter of 16 mm and a wall thickness of 1.3 mm. The wall of the tube is solid, without holes and built-in emitters. A wide selection of fittings and drippers allows you to quickly and easily create a new irrigation system or connect to an existing one. Due to the presence of an ultraviolet filter in the tube, the influence of sunlight on it is reduced, which guarantees long-term use of 4-5 years or more.

The tube is used for draining and applying fertilizers both in open ground and in greenhouses for humidification air with the help of sprayers "Fog". In addition to the usual types of application, it is optimally suitable for watering summer cottages and outbuildings, hedges, potted flowers, gardens, vineyards, berry crops.

The drip tube is easily installed in a short time and with minimal labor costs. Use only water-soluble fertilizers. Before finishing irrigation, flush the tubes to avoid sediment deposition.

Applications

  • Watering crops in open ground
  • Watering crops in greenhouses and greenhouses< /li>
  • Watering seedlings in open and closed ground
  • Watering decorative plants and flowers
  • Home sites

Functional features

  • Simplicity of installation of the system
  • Arbitrary location of droppers
  • Versatile use
  • Allows application of water-soluble fertilizers

Installation

  • Place the tube branches along the rows
  • Lay the main pipe perpendicular to the rows
  • At the beginning of the main pipe mount a filter for water purification. mesh or disk
  • Connect the tube with the supply pipe using starters or taps
  • Put the tube on the starter
  • Drill 3 mm holes at the required distance using a hole punch
  • Install droppers of the desired shape
  • Muffle the end of each branch with a plug
  • In case of mechanical damage blind tube use a repair joint

Buy a dropper Presto-PS tube for automatic watering systems, you can place an order on the website Avtopoliv.com.ua or by phone +38 (063) 135- 55-35.

Section: Drip irrigation / Drip tube / With drippers / With Presto-PS drippers
Description:
Drip tube perennial Presto-PS for organizing systems drip irrigation

Perennial tube is the most versatile and effective solution for organizing drip irrigation systems. The main advantage of a drip tube with built-in droppers, compared to a drip tape, is the possibility of using it for a longer period of time - from 3 to 7 years. A thick wall made of high-quality material allows you not to take the tube away for the winter without reducing its service life.

Presto-PS Perennial Drip Tubing is a PVC a tube with a diameter of 16 mm and a wall thickness of 0.9 mm. Has no seams, burrs and welded joints. Every 20 cm, it has built-in cylindrical droppers (emitters) for 4 outputs with a long filtering labyrinth of a large area for minimal risk of contamination of the dropper. Water consumption from each dropper is 2 l/h. A wide range of fittings allows you to quickly and reliably create a new irrigation system or connect to an existing one.

A perennial tube is used for basal irrigation and application fertilizers both in open ground and in greenhouses. In addition to the usual range of applications, it is optimally suitable for organizing irrigation of gardens, vineyards, berry crops.

The drip tube is easily installed in a short time and with minimal labor costs. Application as part of a special ultraviolet filter reliably protects it from the effects of sunlight and guarantees use for up to 7 years. Use only water-soluble fertilizers. Before finishing irrigation, wash the pipes to avoid sediment deposition.

The maximum permissible length of one branch is 350 meters, the water consumption from one dropper is 2 liters per hour, this must be taken into account for the correct construction of perennial pipe irrigation. Irrigation uniformity 85-90%

Maximum permissible pressure, which guarantees correct operation of drippers up to 2 atmospheres!

Application

  • Watering of agricultural crops on open ground
  • Watering of agricultural crops in greenhouses and greenhouses
  • Watering of seedlings in open and closed ground

Functional features

  • Ease of installation
  • Versatile use
  • Long service life
  • Precise and uniform water discharge along the entire length
  • Maintaining an optimal level of humidity in the root zone of plants
  • Reducing the growth of weeds and the occurrence of fungal plant diseases
  • Used both on small homesteads and in the fields
  • Allows application of water-soluble fertilizers

Installation

  • Lay the branches of the drip tube along the rows
  • Lay the main pipe perpendicular to the rows
  • At the beginning install a filter for water purification in the main pipe. mesh or disk

  • If necessary, separate the tube using tees and corners

Rain Bird® XFCV Dripline Pipeline with High Pressure Pressure Valve 0.24 bar, for surface laying is a valuable addition to Rain Bird's Dripline XF line. The XFCV is the most efficient drip irrigation line in the industry and is ideal where no other drip irrigation line can work.

Even when laying in areas with a difference in elevation, the drip irrigation line remains under pressure thanks to the non-return valve (protected patent pending) that allows static pressure compensation up to 2.5 feet. Rain Bird's XFCV improves irrigation uniformity and prevents flooding at lower points of the site, avoiding puddles and pipe run-off.

This line can use snap-in fittings, Dripline XF push-in fittings and other push-in fittings. 17 mm. Dripline XFCV pipeline for hill work.

Simplicity

Description:
Drip tube blind Irritec for organizing drip irrigation systems

The blind drip tube is the most versatile and inexpensive choice for creating a drip irrigation system. The main advantage of a blind drip tube, in comparison with a drip tape and a perennial tube with drippers, is the ability to organize irrigation in areas with unevenly planted plants.

To build a system based on a blind tube, it is necessary to additionally purchase garden drippers. The distance between the droppers is set arbitrarily, depending on the location of a particular plant. Droppers are installed under the root in holes prepared in advance with a hole punch.

Irritec blind drip tube is a PVC tube with a diameter of 16 mm and a wall thickness of 1 mm. The wall of the tube is solid, without holes and built-in emitters. A wide selection of fittings and drippers allows you to quickly and easily create a new irrigation system or connect to an existing one. Due to the presence of an ultraviolet filter in the tube, the influence of sunlight on it is reduced, which guarantees long-term use of 4-5 years or more.

The drip tube is easily installed in a short time and with minimal labor costs. Use only water-soluble fertilizers. Before finishing irrigation, flush the tubes to avoid sediment deposition.

Applications

  • Watering crops in open ground
  • Watering crops in greenhouses and greenhouses< /li>
  • Watering seedlings in open and closed ground
  • Watering decorative plants and flowers
  • Home sites

Functional features

  • Simplicity of installation of the system
  • Arbitrary location of droppers
  • Versatile use
  • Allows application of water-soluble fertilizers

Installation
